results.title: Fire can be a friend
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Researchers”.
Fire is a natural part of the Australian environment. Fire has been such a dominant factor that many native plants are adapted to periodic burning. Due to the supression of natural fires many square kilometres are being choked by a dense sea of invading shrubs.

results.title: Fire awareness
results.brief_description: Discusses the nature of fire awareness and looks at the nature of fire, the causes of fire, the behaviour of fire and fire safety management. Also looks at fire prevention, protection and supression. Technical advice for the video was supplied by the Metropolitan Fire Brigade, and Fire Prevention Department, Melbourne. A manual complements the video and is issued as a separate loan item.

results.title: Fire and ice [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Polyc International, Ralph Bakshi and Frank Frazetta
results.brief_description: This animated feature is set in a mythical Ice Age, where, Juliana, a powerful Queen of the North, seeks to gain control the rest of the realm. In this realm also resides the good King, Jarol, who lives in his fortress of fire and his sworn enemy, evil ice Lord Nekron, who lives with his army of subhumans amongst the glaciers. Nekron uses his powers of sorcery to create havoc and orders the subhumans to kidnap Jarol’s daughter. Thus a war is waged between fire and ice in a desperate battle for survival. Jarol, with help from the warrior hero Darkwolf must save mankind from the apocalyptic icy grave that awaits them if evil is to reign. Featuring the voices of Stephen Mendel, Maggie Roswell, Leo V. Gordon and Steve Sandor. Director Ralph Bakshi is best known for his animated adult feature “Fritz the cat”.

results.title: Fire's the enemy
results.brief_description: Shows recent developments in civil defence training: the latest fire-fighting equipment; emergencies a community may have to cope with during a serious outbreak and how the individual as well as the community may deal with an actual attack. Training of new recruits is also described.

results.title: Fire's on - Lapstone tunnel by Arthur Streeton, 1891
results.creator_credit: Malcolm Otton, Art Gallery of New South Wales, David Muir and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “The Australian eye I”.
The death of a workman during blasting of the railway tunnel at Lapstone in the NSW Blue Mountains in 1891 was Arthur Streeton’s inspiration for this painting. Streeton’s vivid description of the accident in a letter to his artist friend Tom Roberts is included in the commentary. Written by David Muir and edited by Ian Walker.
results.title_for_label: Fire’s on - Lapstone tunnel by Arthur Streeton, 1891
results.creator_credit_for_label: Malcolm Otton, Art Gallery of New South Wales, David Muir and Film Australia

results.title: Fire
results.creator_credit: Bruce Norman and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”.
An investigation of the causes of the dramatic increase in fire-incidence figures in Britain. Demonstrates some of the new and unexpected fire hazards produced by our consumer society - new fabrics, high rise buildings and shopping precincts. Looks at research into fire prevention, and tests the public’s ability to use fire extinguishers.
